main event: A farmer reported seeing a saucer-shaped object, about 25 feet in diameter and 12-15 feet thick, being launched from an Army C-54 aircraft in Dowagiac, Michigan on June 29, 1950.
interesting points: The farmer, John Keller, said the object made a high-pitched sound as it rose straight up and easily outdistanced the C-54 aircraft, disappearing from sight in seconds.
Keller described the object as having a chrome-like top with a small dome and a dull gray bottom.
Keller's two young sons also witnessed the launching of the object from the C-54.

The document also includes a report of a sighting by Dr. L.C. Vatter in Chicago on July 1, 1950, who described a round, intensely bright, and soundless object moving at a terrific rate of speed across the sky.
No further investigation was contemplated by the Fifth Army headquarters.
sighted object: saucer-shaped object, about 25 feet in diameter and 12-15 feet thick
witnesses: farmer John Keller and his two sons
photographs: no, the report does not include any photographs
